newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli shelling kills Lebanese shepherd.
newsitem.headline: Israeli shelling kills Lebanese shepherd.

text.p: A shepherd was killed on Thursday when Israeli and allied militia forces shelled the outskirts of a village in south Lebanon, security sources said.

They said Khodor Shehadeh, 23, was killed when shells slammed near the village of Froun just north of a south Lebanon zone occupied by Israeli forces. He was the second Lebanese civilian killed in Israeli shelling in three days.

Sources with the Israeli-backed South Lebanon Army (SLA) militia said at about the same time that guerrillas fired mortar bombs and anti-tank rockets at a post manned by the militiamen at Shoumariyeh on the edge of the zone facing Froun.
Israeli and SLA forces returned fire, they added.
Earlier on Thursday, guerrillas attacked another SLA post at Toumat Niha in another sector of the south.
On Tuesday, a civilian woman was killed by Israeli shelling after guerrillas shelled three SLA posts in the zone.
Lebanon has complained over Tuesday's killing to a five-nation committee monitoring a U.S.-brokered south Lebanon ceasefire agreement that bars both sides from targeting civilians.

The ceasefire monitors from the United States, France, Lebanon, Syria and Israel began a meeting on Wednesday to discuss the Lebanese complaint and are still in session at U.N. peacekers' headquarters in Naqoura in the south Lebanon zone.

The pro-Iranian Hizbollah (Party of God) leads a guerrilla war on Israeli and SLA forces in a bid to oust them from the 15-km (nine-miles) -deep south Lebanon zone set up to prevent cross-border attacks on northern Israel.
